fields.question: What is pneumonia?
fields.feedbackA: Pneumonia is a type of lung infection caused by bacteria, viruses, or fungi.
fields.feedbackB: Pneumonia is a type of lung infection caused by bacteria, viruses, or fungi.
fields.feedbackC: Pneumonia is a type of lung infection caused by bacteria, viruses, or fungi.
fields.suggestion: Pneumonia is a type of lung infection caused by bacteria, viruses, or fungi.

fields.question: Pneumonia is infection of the lungs caused by:
fields.feedbackA: Pneumonia is an infection of the lungs. It may be caused by bacteria, viruses, fungi, or parasites.
fields.feedbackB: Pneumonia is an infection of the lungs. It may be caused by bacteria, viruses, fungi, or parasites.
fields.feedbackC: Pneumonia is an infection of the lungs. It may be caused by bacteria, viruses, fungi, or parasites.
fields.suggestion: Pneumonia is an infection of the lungs. It may be caused by bacteria, viruses, fungi, or parasites.

fields.question: What are symptoms of pneumonia?
fields.choiceA: A. Cough, fever, and chills are symptoms of pneumonia.
fields.choiceB: B. Rash, painful joints, and itching skin.
fields.feedbackA: Symptoms of pneumonia may be mild to severe, and can vary depending on your age and health, and what type of pneumonia you have.
fields.feedbackB: Symptoms of pneumonia may be mild to severe, and can vary depending on your age and health, and what type of pneumonia you have.
fields.feedbackC: Symptoms of pneumonia may be mild to severe, and can vary depending on your age and health, and what type of pneumonia you have.
fields.suggestion: Symptoms of pneumonia may be mild to severe, and can vary depending on your age and health, and what type of pneumonia you have.

fields.question: Pneumonia can be a life-threatening infection.
fields.feedbackA: While many cases of pneumonia can be mild such as with walking pneumonia, left untreated some cases of pneumonia can be serious and even life-threatening.
fields.feedbackB: While many cases of pneumonia can be mild such as with walking pneumonia, left untreated some cases of pneumonia can be serious and even life-threatening.
fields.feedbackC: While many cases of pneumonia can be mild such as with walking pneumonia, left untreated some cases of pneumonia can be serious and even life-threatening.
fields.suggestion: While many cases of pneumonia can be mild such as with walking pneumonia, left untreated some cases of pneumonia can be serious and even life-threatening.

fields.question: Is pneumonia contagious?
fields.feedbackA: Causes of pneumonia such as bacteria or viruses can be contagious. The period in which a person is contagious can range from one or two days to up to two weeks.
fields.feedbackB: Causes of pneumonia such as bacteria or viruses can be contagious. The period in which a person is contagious can range from one or two days to up to two weeks.
fields.feedbackC: Causes of pneumonia such as bacteria or viruses can be contagious. The period in which a person is contagious can range from one or two days to up to two weeks.
fields.suggestion: Causes of pneumonia such as bacteria or viruses can be contagious. The period in which a person is contagious can range from one or two days to up to two weeks.

fields.question: Is there a vaccine against pneumonia?
fields.feedbackA: There are currently vaccines to prevent two types of pneumonia.
fields.feedbackB: There are currently vaccines to prevent two types of pneumonia.
fields.feedbackC: There are currently vaccines to prevent two types of pneumonia.
fields.suggestion: There are currently vaccines to prevent two types of pneumonia.

fields.question: The flu vaccine has to be administered to prevent pneumonia:
fields.feedbackA: The flu vaccine has to be administered every year to prevent pneumonia caused by influenza virus.
fields.feedbackB: The flu vaccine has to be administered every year to prevent pneumonia caused by influenza virus.
fields.feedbackC: The flu vaccine has to be administered every year to prevent pneumonia caused by influenza virus.
fields.suggestion: The flu vaccine has to be administered every year to prevent pneumonia caused by influenza virus.

fields.question: Except for getting vaccine, which of the following statement can be seen as a tip for preventing pneumonia?
fields.choiceC: C. Wash hands often in warm and soapy water.
fields.feedbackB: Eat a healthy diet that includes lots of fruits, vegetables, fibre, and lean protein.
fields.feedbackC: Keeping your hands clean to prevent pneumonia.
fields.suggestion: Keeping your hands clean to prevent pneumonia.

fields.question: How many doses of pneumococcal vaccine should children under 12 months receive?
Which of the following statement is wrong regarding to strength the immune system to prevent pneumonia?
fields.feedbackA: Smokers are at higher risk of getting pneumonia.
fields.feedbackB: Smokers are at higher risk of getting pneumonia.
fields.feedbackC: Smokers are at higher risk of getting pneumonia.
fields.suggestion: Smokers are at higher risk of getting pneumonia.

fields.question: What should you do if you are diagnosed with pneumonia?
fields.choiceA: A.	Cover the mouth when sneezing or coughing.
fields.feedbackA: Once you are diagnosed with pneumonia, avoid close contact with anyone.
fields.feedbackB: Once you are diagnosed with pneumonia, avoid close contact with anyone.
fields.feedbackC: Once you are diagnosed with pneumonia, avoid close contact with anyone.
fields.suggestion: Once you are diagnosed with pneumonia, avoid close contact with anyone.

fields.question: What can be the treatment for pneumonia?
fields.feedbackA: Treatment depends on the age of the individual and the type of infection, but can include hospital admission, plenty of fluids, medications and etc.
fields.feedbackB: Treatment depends on the age of the individual and the type of infection, but can include hospital admission, plenty of fluids, medications and etc.
fields.feedbackC: Treatment depends on the age of the individual and the type of infection, but can include hospital admission, plenty of fluids, medications and etc.
fields.suggestion: Treatment depends on the age of the individual and the type of infection, but can include hospital admission, plenty of fluids, medications and etc.

fields.question: If children have the symptoms of pneumonia, should they see the doctors immediately?
fields.feedbackA: See the doctor immediately, since pneumonia can be life threatening to babies and young children.
fields.feedbackB: See the doctor immediately, since pneumonia can be life threatening to babies and young children.
fields.feedbackC: See the doctor immediately, since pneumonia can be life threatening to babies and young children.
fields.suggestion: See the doctor immediately, since pneumonia can be life threatening to babies and young children.

fields.question: Which age group can be more likely to get pneumonia or develop a more severe illness?
fields.choiceA: A. Babies and young children under 2 years old.
fields.feedbackA: Babies and young children 2 and people over 65 are more likely to get pneumonia.
fields.feedbackB: Babies and young children 2 and people over 65 are more likely to get pneumonia.
fields.feedbackC: Babies and young children 2 and people over 65 are more likely to get pneumonia.
fields.suggestion: Babies and young children 2 and people over 65 are more likely to get pneumonia.

fields.question: Can children get the pneumonia vaccine and the flu vaccine at the same time?
fields.feedbackA: Children should not get the pneumonia vaccine and the flu vaccine at the same time, this may increase the risk of having fever-related seizures.
fields.feedbackB: Children should not get the pneumonia vaccine and the flu vaccine at the same time, this may increase the risk of having fever-related seizures.
fields.feedbackC: Children should not get the pneumonia vaccine and the flu vaccine at the same time, this may increase the risk of having fever-related seizures.
